nodes.text: If the Pentagon doesn't keep track of ground-launched cluster munitions it had better start
This information is very important especially when the weapon has been improperly used in urban areas.
If an information is important to save lives of civilians the nation must reveal it
Launched bombs are a danger for civilians
The knowledge of the number of launched bombs can help to evaluate and avoid the danger for the population
Several of the ground-launched cluster munitions in service with U.S. and U.K. forces produce an unacceptably high percentage of de facto landmines when they fail to function on impact
Official U.S. data documents a minimum of 14 to 16 percent dud rates for common ground launched cluster munitions. These dud rates climb when the impact environment includes vegetation or structures.
Landmines are a danger for civilians
